metadata.title: CVE-2017-10689 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In previous versions of Puppet Agent it was possible to install a modulewith world writable permissions. Puppet Agent 5.3.4 and 1.10.10 included afix to this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10689` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

puppet - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
puppet-common - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
puppet-el - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
puppet-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
puppetmaster - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
puppetmaster-common - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
puppetmaster-passenger - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
vim-puppet - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: puppet package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1.3').
